Journal Story: Five Pair will return to the AT in March, 2021, with a friend for at NOBO.  Ground Control to support as done with the Five Pair 2012 Hike.

As Five Pair's 2012 hike is known in our little corner of the world and she has decided to hike again, she now has two friends, that have committed to join the 2021 adventure.  Conversations regarding planning and logistics are beginning and updates will occur if new members of the hiking group join and as gear is acquired.  As with the prior hike, a web presence will occur to keep family and friends updated.

The group is now four and tomorrow marks the first time the group will strap on their back packs and take a walk together for a short test hike with their new gear.  March 21 looks to be the date.  More to follow.

With 27 days until Springer, the four campers are doing a "test drive" on some of their gear tomorrow and will camp together for the first time.  Sadly, Five Pair's new tent isn't scheduled to arrive until the end of the week.
Gear test complete and all was well.

The Four continue their preparations as they are now inside 3 weeks before they arrive at Springer.  You might wonder how one attempts to prepare for the elevation changes on the AT when hiking in central Florida.  Answer?  Bridges... repeatedly.  :)   So The Four are spending time repeatedly traversing local bridges with their fully loaded backpacks.  More info to follow on the hikers soon at the journal.  Link below.UPDATE:  I've been corrected. Not "Bridges", "Causeways"

A fifth member of the hiking group has joined fir which gear acquisition scrambling is occurring and the phrase "It's gonna be a hoot!" has never been more apropos.
Last minute considerations, packing, weighing, discarding and reweighing is in full swing.
0.1 ounce has never felt so heavy :)

The Five began their journey and enjoyed a good first day.
More info and pictures at website below.
Second day goes well with eyes towards the sky as the rain is predicted to arrive tomorrow.More info and pictures at website below.
The hikers were anxious to get to Neels Gap before the predicted rain descended so they pushed hard today. More details on website.

Given the rain prediction, a delayed start occurred and a short hike followed to stay clear of the lightning and thunderstorms.
More details on website.
Lightning and thunderstorms was the order of the day so a Zero ensued.  More details on website.
Four Hoots continue the journey and hit the 50 mile mark.  More details at website.
Trail Magic, ascents and descents and a good-bye.  More details on website.
It was a very windy, wet night which followed them into this day.  More details at website.
The Hoots complete Georgia and race into North Carolina as storm is coming.  More details and pictures at website, link below.
More weather, so its off to Franklin and catchup on Trail folks met and other non-hiking info.  Pictures and details at website, link below.
Large weather front moving through so Hoots take zero.
A cold hike, transport concern and good-bye to a Hoot.  More details and pictures at website.  Link below.
Just Two Hoots hiking in very cold temps.  More info and pictures at website.  Link below.
Nice day hiking with water a plenty and a friendly pickup.  Info and pictures at website.  Link below.
Lots of balds to be hiked along with two distinct versions of Trail Magic.  For more pictures and detail at website, link below.
A beautiful day with views and a visit to NOC.  More pictures and details at website, link below.
Warm temperatures greet the hikers as they push towards Fontana Dam, the doorway to the Great Smoky Mountains.  Pictures and details at website, link below.
The Hoots head to Fontana Dam as weather is arriving.  More details and pictures at website, link below.
Its a rainy day zero so an update on Hikers, History and Bucket.  More info and pictures at website, link below.
Across the dam and into the Great Smoky Mountains.  More info at website, link below.
The Hoots engaged in a rain shortened hike.  More info and a picture at website, link below.
The two Hoots worked their way east as they approach the 200 miles hiked mark.  More info at website, link below.
The Hoots enjoy Clingmans Dome as they hike through the Smoky Mountains and pass the 200 miles hiked mark.  More details and photos at website, link below.

Editor's note: catching up on a couple days.The Hoots continue through the Great Smoky Mountains as they are in the final days with this one being particularly windy and hiking at elevation.  More photos and details at website, link below.
The last day of the Great Smoky Mountains as the Hoots hike out and look to resupply.  More details and photos at website, link below.
Slack packing to Max Patch and the arranged pickup that didn't arrive or respond.  More details and pictures at website. Link below.
Another hiking day driven by rain planning and an ankle causing trouble.  More details and pictures at website.  Link below.
The Hoots took separate paths today and met back up at Hot Springs.  Details at the website, link below.
A zero in Hot Springs means food, resupply and RICE for Five Pair.  For details and photos at website, link below.
The Hoots hike out of Hot Springs and their paths diverge six miles in.  More details and pictures at website. Link below.
Mileage heads out with a couple new gadgets and passes a milestone.  More pictures and details at website.  Link below.
Cold, snow and sleet was the unwelcomed companions of the day as Mileage hiked along with Gourmet and Fidget.  Photos and details at website, link below.
A short day today featuring a challenging ascent and windy, cold conditions. Details and photos at website.  Link below.
Another cold, windy, dreary day with a visit to Big Bald.  More details and pictures at website, link below.
Rain, rain, and more rain dampened the trail and spirits but Mileage, Gourmet and Fidget hike into Erwin and deal with a scene out of Seinfeld.  More details and photos at website.  Link below.

Editor Note: Apologies for the disappearance and lack of entries.  Life got in the way of fun.
Mileage is still working her way north and is in Pennsylvania.  Five Pair is at home healing as the MRI revealed a fractured tibia and two torn ligaments.
